citations.narrative:
One adult male Egyptian Mau cat had no collar/tag, tattoo, microchip, or other official identification. This cat was housed
with an adult female Geoffroy’s cat. Live cats and dogs acquired by class “B” dealers must be immediately identified by a
collar and tag, tattoo, or microchip. Failure to properly identify animals may lead to the inability to trace animals and
coordinate records and care. Correct to ensure that all animals are properly identified no later than 7/19/23.

In an enclosure housing one caracal, there is a dilapidated wooden platform that leans to one side causing possible
instability of the structure. On one side, this platform has numerous protruding nails creating sharp points. An unstable
structure with sharp points could lead to unnecessary injury to the animal. The facility shall be maintained in good repair
to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. The facility must ensure platforms within the enclosure are
structurally sound and do not have sharp points. Correct by 6/19/23.

According to the licensee, in January 2023, three bare-tailed woolly opossums were found deceased in their enclosure
following three nights of inclement and freezing weather. The animals were housed in a large shelter consisting of a roof,
rear and side walls with closed doors and access to heating pads. According to the National Weather Service,
temperatures for the area were below 50 degrees Fahrenheit for 15 days out of 31 days for the month of January. The
shelter alone was inadequate to protect the animals from the low temperatures observed in the area during the month of
January. Adequate shelter appropriate to the climactic conditions for the species concerned shall be provided for all
animals kept outdoors to afford them protection. Correct from this day forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(b)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
One adult male Egyptian Mau cat had no collar/tag, tattoo, microchip, or other official identification. This cat was housed 
with an adult female Geoffroy’s cat. Live cats and dogs acquired by class “B” dealers must be immediately identified by a 
collar and tag, tattoo, or microchip. Failure to properly identify animals may lead to the inability to trace animals and 
coordinate records and care. Correct to ensure that all animals are properly identified no later than 7/19/23. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
In an enclosure housing one caracal, there is a dilapidated wooden platform that leans to one side causing possible 
instability of the structure. On one side, this platform has numerous protruding nails creating sharp points. An unstable 
structure with sharp points could lead to unnecessary injury to the animal. The facility shall be maintained in good repair 
to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. The facility must ensure platforms within the enclosure are 
structurally sound and do not have sharp points. Correct by 6/19/23. 
3.127(b)  Critical
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
According to the licensee, in January 2023, three bare-tailed woolly opossums were found deceased in their enclosure 
following three nights of inclement and freezing weather. The animals were housed in a large shelter consisting of a roof,

rear and side walls with closed doors and access to heating pads. According to the National Weather Service, 
temperatures for the area were below 50 degrees Fahrenheit for 15 days out of 31 days for the month of January. The 
shelter alone was inadequate to protect the animals from the low temperatures observed in the area during the month of 
January. Adequate shelter appropriate to the climactic conditions for the species concerned shall be provided for all 
animals kept outdoors to afford them protection. Correct from this day forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
